TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicant is a member of the Haber - Sen , a trade union formed by public employees . He is also a member of ORG ( ORG – “ KESK ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested in PERSON and taken to ORG of ORG on charges of having insulted a police officer . He had allegedly attempted to resist arrest . During his detention in police custody , the applicant was allegedly beaten up , slapped and threatened with death by the police officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicant was taken to ORG , where he was examined by a doctor . In his report , the doctor indicated the presence of hyperaemia on the applicant ’s cheeks and another red mark measuring QUANTITY on his back . The doctor concluded that the injuries in question ( hyperaemia ) would heal in DATE and would not render the applicant unfit for work .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before ORG and the ORG respectively , where he complained that he had been beaten up and threatened with death during his detention in police custody . He was subsequently placed in pre - trial detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant underwent a new medical examination at ORG by a surgeon , who stated in her report that there were healing wounds and haematoma caused by a blunt object on the applicant ’s shoulder blades .
CARDINAL . On DATE another doctor at ORG examined the applicant and stated in his medical report that there was no sign of physical violence on his body .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint against the police officers who had allegedly ill - treated and insulted him .

CARDINAL . According to a photo identification report dated DATE , the applicant was shown photos of CARDINAL police officers from the AntiTerrorism Branch of ORG and identified the QUANTITY police officers who had ill - treated and threatened him .

CARDINAL . DATE senior police officers , who had been appointed as investigators , took statements from the QUANTITY police officers who had allegedly ill - treated the applicant . The police officers all denied the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment . They claimed that the applicant had made slanderous allegations in an attempt to waste their time and to demean the police force . The applicant also made statements to the senior police officers and claimed that he had been slapped , insulted and threatened with death by QUANTITY police officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG delivered a decision of non - prosecution in respect of the applicant ’s allegations that he had been insulted and threatened while in police custody . On DATE , the public prosecutor filed an indictment with ORG against CARDINAL police officers , accusing them of ill - treatment under LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG decided to stay the proceedings against the accused police officers and transferred the case file to ORG to obtain authorisation to bring criminal proceedings against the officers pursuant to the provisions of the PERSON on the prosecution of civil servants .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided not to authorise prosecution on the ground that there was insufficient evidence to indicate that the police officers had inflicted illtreatment on the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against ORG decision . He argued that the conclusion that there was no evidence proving ill - treatment was ill - founded and unjust in view of the medical reports , which clearly indicated that he had been beaten up during his detention in police custody .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile , a disciplinary investigation was also conducted against the QUANTITY police officers in question . However , on DATE , relying on the conclusion reached by ORG , ORG of the Muğla Governorship decided to terminate the investigation against the accused police officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE a law ( Law no . DATE ) on conditional release was enacted . This law provided for the suspension of proceedings or execution of sentences in respect of crimes committed before DATE and for which the maximum penalty did not exceed CARDINAL years’ imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to suspend the criminal proceedings against the accused police officers pursuant to LAW no . DATE . The applicant appealed against this decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG decision .
